column2: Project Cyan - Requirements for Distributed Carbon Capture
Dahl Winters, 1/5/2021
references in Column F and at the bottom
Summary: A top-down analysis of how to meet a near-term climate goal via
numerous low-cost (<$100), distributed, small-scale direct air carbon capture (DACC) devices.
Goal: Use consumer-available materials with minimal environmental impact.
Simple, low-cost system design that can be done at home.
Level of Distribution and Flow Rates Needed

HCl hydrolyzes cellulose - creates sugars that can be used for biofuel
HCl neutralized by dissolving waste concrete to calcium chloride and water
Prior work mentions this overall reaction but different design; patent has expired
Carbonatation process is slow in concrete
Dry ice production at 13 MT/hour possible
Emissions-free lime through electrochemistry
